job_description:
• Type of Requisition:RegularClearance Level Must Currently Possess:NoneClearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain:NonePublic Trust/Other Required:NACI (T1)Job Family:IT Infrastructure and OperationsJob Qualifications:Skills:Snowflake (Platform), Snowflake Data Warehouse, Snowflake GenAICertifications:NoneExperience:5 + years of related experienceUS Citizenship Required:NoJob Description:General Dynamics Information Technology (GDIT) provides healthcare information technology services and resources to support the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS).
• You will collaborate closely with ETL developers, data architects, security engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure that Snowflake supports enterprise-wide analytics, data integration, and reporting needs.
• Exercise strong interpersonal and communication skills while working independently and collaboratively within a high-performing agile team.
• Analyze complex business and technical requirements to design and implement performant and secure Snowflake database solutions.
• EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related technical field, or equivalent combination of education, certifications, and experience.
• 5+ years of IT experience with deep expertise in database administration, with at least 2 years managing enterprise-scale Snowflake deployments.
• Proven experience managing petabyte-scale Snowflake environments in production.
• Experience in cloud-native ETL/ELT development using AWS Services, Databricks, or similar platforms.

• A foundational understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithmsSome experience with Python and common ML libraries (e.
• , scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy)Familiarity with SQL and relational databases (Postgres is a big plus)A strong desire to learn and grow in the fields of machine learning, data engineering, and DevOpsExcellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environmentFormal training in Data Science, Statistics, Research Science or a related field (e.
• , a bachelor's degree, bootcamp, or certificate program), or equivalent practical experienceApplicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or in the future.
• PDI Technologies is unable to offer visa sponsorship for this role Develop and experiment with AI agents to solve complex security challengesDesign, build, train, and deploy machine learning models using Python and AWS SageMakerCollaborate with data engineers to ensure data quality and availability for model developmentWrite clean, maintainable, and efficient Python code for our APIs and services using FastAPIContribute to the team's data management strategy using dbt and SQLStay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning.
